Here's the latest issue. Reports created in 2.2 cannot be read when
copied/renamed/moved to another install. We check all our reports into
svn so we can distribute and share

boxes. I believe we can recreate this error on all the above systems.

I am seeing this same exception (see stack trace below) being thrown on the same line (MultiPageReportEditor.java:222) when I try to open a report design that was programmatically created using the report design API. The code to design the report was written against the 2.1 API, and that same code still works under the 2.2 API and I can execute the report programmatically through the report engine API without error. The exception happens when I try to open the report design file in the 2.2 all-in-one Eclipse/BIRT installation. I can open the file from the 2.1 all-in-one Eclipse/BIRT installation without error.

I only have one installation of each version of BIRT (2.1 and 2.2) and the file only fails when opening it in the 2.2 installation. Both versions of Eclipse/BIRT are installed on Windows XP, and the report design file is created under Tomcat 5.5.23 running on Windows XP.

I have also tried the copy/paste suggestion in a previous post and that DOES work under one specific circumstance. If I open my original design file in a text editor, copy the entire contents, create a NEW report design in the Eclipse/BIRT 2.2 all-in-one installation, select the entire contents of that new design and paste my programmatically generated design file contents over it (completely replace the XML contents of the new design file) and then save that file, it runs in the report viewer and the report preview tab, and can be opened and closed without any exceptions. This works as long as the design file is saved into the open project location (the project folder is not contained within the workspace folder, but a reference to it has been imported into the workspace). If I take this same file and relocate it to another folder that is on the same hard drive, but not in the project folder or in the workspace folder, it will not open. If I copy a generated design file unmodified into the project folder, I can not open that file (the only way to open it is to do the copy/paste thing).

I am attaching my original programmatically created design file and that same file as copy/pasted into a UI created design file for your reference. A comparison shows that these files are identical. I suspect that neither of them will open in another project or workspace than my own.

This issue for me is not a show-stopper since my design files still run when executed through the report engine API, which is how our application works. It does, however, make it difficult to debug issues with those design files. For now, I will use the copy/paste work-around to handle cases where I need to debug the design files.
